title: What is the element with 6 protons, 6 electrons, and 5 neutrons? - Quora

response.answer_text: The number of protons says it is carbon. To be exact, it is Carbon-11 (sum of protons and neutrons), which is a highly radioactive isotope with a half-life of only 20 minutes (so it does not occur naturally). It decays to Boron-11 (5 protons, 6 neutrons) usually by emitting a positron, occasionally by capturing an electron.
This is called Carbon 11, it is an unstable isotope of carbon that decays in around 20 minutes. For a list of known isotopes of carbon please look at Isotopes of carbon - Wikipedia
